title: The Great Score Strike
outcome: Galvanized by the Ledger’s revelations, citizens organize a mass campaign to disrupt the BCI by confusing and erasing their scores. Neighborhoods coordinate public acts to jumble or erase records. Amid Directorate crackdowns and widespread score manipulation, Innovators propose radical transparency, letting everyone modify and see scores, resulting in further social chaos and an uncertain future.

events.description: A viral "Erase My Score!" movement spreads, with neighborhoods openly defying BCI tracking and staging synchronized disruptions of digital records.
Directorate forces conduct mass interventions to restore BCI scoring, leading to citywide confrontations and network outages as citizens resist reclassification.
Innovators propose an 'open score' model: BCI scores are temporarily visible and editable by all citizens. The shift is chaotic, with rampant manipulation and no reliable compliance measures.
Widespread confusion over access to jobs and housing as manipulated scores disrupt allocations. Public trust in both BCI and the Council reaches a new low.
